repnme.cdata!: Zambia - Mining Sector Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mining Sector Technical Assistance
            Project for the Republic of Zambia achieved an
            unsatisfactory overall outcome. The project aimed to support
            three organizations: the majority Government-owned Zambia
            Consolidated Copper Mines Ltd. (ZCCM), the Ministry of Mines
            and Minerals Development (MMMD), and Maamba Collieries. The
            project objectives relating to MMMD and Maamba Collieries
            were largely successful, but those relating to ZCCM were not
            accomplished. Project sustainability is rated as uncertain.
            The failure to assist ZCCM precludes sustainable solutions
            in that component. However, the outlook for long-term
            sustainability of the mining sector is positive, provided
            the ongoing privatization of ZCCM is completed. Bank
            performance is rated as satisfactory. Bank staff worked
            rapidly and intensively in response to Government requests
            and in the face of deteriorating ZCCM performance. Borrower
            performance is rated as satisfactory. Although ZCCM
            management was unable to correct deteriorating performance,
            the Government and MMMD worked well in preparation,
            implementation, and cooperation with the private sector. Key
            lessons learned revolve around the importance of:
            flexibility in the design of project operations; design of a
            regulatory and legal framework to support private sector
            investment; the articulation of clear policies; and
            technical assistance operations as a starting point for
            sector reform. The project revealed the impact of these
            concepts on project responsiveness to changing conditions;
            on privatization initiatives; and on consensus building.
            Also, a clear separation of objectives and associated
            components can allow for partial successes. Finally, the new
            organizational structure, of a Country Director supported by
            a Country Team, enabled team operations across institutional boundaries.

repnme.cdata!: Zambia - Mining Sector Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mining Sector Technical assistance
            Project will help the government of Zambia to implement an
            effective development strategy for the mining sector.  In
            the short term, the strategy aims at making the mining
            sector more efficient and productive than currently, so that
            mining can continue to generate the resources needed to
            support recovery and diversification of the Zambian economy.
            In the longer term, the strategy will support the
            development of new copper mines by private investors.  The
            project will achieve the objectives by:  (a) assisting
            Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) to improve its
            mining and metallurgical operations with a particular focus
            on lowering costs; (ii) supporting development and
            implementation of a comprehensive corporate plan which will
            include an efficient phase-down plan for certain ZCCM mining
            operations with depleting reserves; (iii) assisting ZCCM in
            joint-venturing its undeveloped copper resources and in the
            divestiture of subsidiaries and/or assets with little direct
            relation to mining; (iv) supporting a program to encourage
            new private investments in gemstone mining; (v) facilitating
            the preparation of a plan to assist small-scale miners,
            especially gemstone miners; (vi) developing a long-run
            strategy for Maamba Collieries; and (vii) assisting in
            developing environmental regulations for mining and
            providing support to the protection of the environment in
            the areas mined by ZCCM, Maamba and the small-scale miners.
